Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer
Cleveland's bullpen combined for seven innings of four-hit ball
Pedro Avila (6-1) got six outs for the win
Eli Morgan, Cade Smith, Tim Herrin, Hunter Gaddis and Erik Sabrowski combined to close it out
Post-Match Reflections: You just work day in and day out, and eventually you find something that kind of helps
Those guys stepped up in a huge way
We had a couple of good swings here and there
We got some guys on, but just not the big hit when guys were on and weren’t able to grind at-bats and make them work at all
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thomas also doubled and scored on Kyle Manzardo's second-inning single
Led by Thomas and their reliable bullpen, the AL Central-leading Guardians stayed 3 1/2 games ahead of second-place Kansas City
The 32-year-old Lively was hit on the outside of his right leg by Dominic Fletcher’s liner in the second
White Sox rookie Jonathan Cannon (3-10) was charged with three runs and seven hits in 5 1/3 innings
Burke, a third-round pick in the 2021 amateur draft who was hampered by shoulder soreness last year, likely will make at least one start for Chicago in the final part of the season
Others: The White Sox are closing in on the post-1900 record for losses — 120 by the 1962 New York Mets in their inaugural season
